availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky farmer. Lived in Hancock County in 1860. Married to Nancy M. Blincoe Mason. Father of Vertura E. Mason, Richard W. Mason, Mary R. Mason, Kate Mason, Robert Mason, Mike Mason, Margret "Maggie" Mason, Thomas Mason, Henry Mason, James Mason, Mannie Mason, and Charles Mason. Owned six enslaved persons in 1860. A founding member of the Hancock Pond Draining Company in 1850.

bibl.p: "An Act to Incorporate the Hancock Pond Draining Company, and amend the charter of the Jefferson Pond Draining Company," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Passed at December Session, 1849 (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G.
